title.narrative: EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE

description.narrative: By 2016, in provinces and territories at high risk for disasters and health emergencies, mechanisms for coordination and participation of civil society for emergency preparedness and response will have been established., which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Maternal And Newborn Health, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017 UNICEF will have contributed to reduce the average and the gaps in maternal and infant mortality and the vertical transmission of HIV and congenital syphilis, to improve access to inclusive and quality health services, strengthening the early detection of disabilities, and to increase the coverage of health and nutrition programmes for children 0 to 5 years of age.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, in provinces and territories at high risk for disasters and health emergencies, mechanisms for coordination andparticipation of civil society for emergency preparedness and response will have been established.

description.narrative: WASH in emergency was made more resilient through strengthening capacities in risk analysis and information management at the national and regional level. UNICEF provided a small-scale hurricane response in WASH. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/12/2017
